definition: to keep an appointment
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: Please tell Mr. Luman that Mr. Fisher will not be able to keep the appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请转告鲁曼先生，费希尔先生不能如期赴约。

sentences.english: Sally agreed to be my date tonight.
sentences.chinese: 莎丽同意今晚跟我出赴约会。

sentences.english: Then one day the husband arrived ahead of schedule for an appointment with a headhunter.
sentences.chinese: 一天，丈夫约好了一家猎头公司并提前赴约。

sentences.english: Emma never arrives punctually so you can expect to be waiting.
sentences.chinese: 爱玛是从不准时赴约的，你就做好等的准备吧。

sentences.english: She arrived bright and early for the appointment.
sentences.chinese: 她满面春风早早地赴约来了。

sentences.english: After two months, I started scheduling dates with men and then not showing up.
sentences.chinese: 两个月后，我开始计划和异性约会，却从没赴约。

sentences.english: Something urgent has happened. I won't be able to make it this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 发生了紧急的事情，下午我不能够赴约。

sentences.english: The young female reporter was on time, and the interview got under way immediately.
sentences.chinese: 一位年轻的女记者准时赴约，于是采访立即开始进行。

sentences.english: Gretchen has gone to meet with Self at Rita's house.
sentences.chinese: 格雷琴没有赴约，她去丽塔家与赛尔夫会面。

sentences.english: The young girl received the invitation, but she didn't accept it.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻的女孩收了邀请卡，但是她没有同意赴约。

sentences.english: Jane was teed off when her boy friend failed to keep the date.
sentences.chinese: 男朋友没有赴约，简很生气。

sentences.english: Try to land an interview between 9 a.m. and 11 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 试试在早上9点至11点去赴约会。

sentences.english: Why didn’t you come with your camomile?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么没有带着你的菊花来赴约？

sentences.english: Love is not being suspicious when she misses an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 爱是她没有赴约也不心生怀疑。

sentences.english: Love is not hoeing suspicious when she misers an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 爱是她没有赴约也不心生怀疑。

sentences.english: And I just wanna be sure I've picked the right T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 我得保证穿最合适的T恤去赴约。

definition: to go to a meeting
to attend a banquet
appointment/engagement/date/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]/to arrange to meet
to miss an appointment
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to ask sb out (on a date etc)
to miss an appointment
to see each other/to meet in person
to meet together
to invite/to make an appointment
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to meet/to hold a meeting
to meet/to see each other/CL:次[ci4]
to tactfully decline/to turn down gracefully
to hit on someone/to strike up a conversation/to start talking to end an awkward silence or embarrassing situation
